data.name: Bresenham Circle Algorithm
data.description:
# Bresenham Circle Algorithm

### Task

Code function `circle` with bresenham algorithm without using any `floats`, `*`, `/`, `%`.

`Algorithm using only integer arithmetic` can be found on the [wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midpoint_circle_algorithm#Variant_with_integer-based_arithmetic).

Function `circle` accepts 5 parameters: 

The first two parameters ```xc, yc```, are coordinates of center for the circle of radius ``r`` to draw on ``screen`` using ``color``. 

``screen`` is a 2d array of char (or string length 1) for example ``screen(13, 7, '⬜')`` generate:

```
[
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
]
```

``color`` is the char to use to plot pixels of the circle on the screen. 

### Example :

``circle(5, 3, 3, screen(13, 7, '⬜'), '⬛')``

shoud return :

```
[
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬛", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬛", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
]
```

You need to plot pixels of the circle in the screen array and returning it.

Please note:

1. origin of screen is top / left (screen[0][0])
2. new screen must be returned
3. color will always be ``⬛`` and background will be ``⬜``
4. screen could already have some pixels drawn (multicircle and random tests)
5. all circles will be drawn entirely on screen (no clipping needed)
6. screen function is a helper to generate a screen 2d array width x height pixels using a char as background color
7. `floats`, `*`, `/`, `%` are not allowed in this kata. Bit shifting is.
8. in tests expected screen is in green and actual wrong is in red. Screen is white when it's ok.
